conclusion: To solve the problem of finding the gravitational force F exerted by the remaining part of the sphere on the point mass m, we need to follow these steps.
The mass of a uniformly dense sphere is given by M = ρ · V where ρ is the density and V is the volume.
Calculate the mass of the original sphere: M = ρ · (4/3)πR^3
Determine the mass of the removed sphere: M_removed = ρ · (1/6)πR^3
Calculate the mass of the remaining part: M_remaining = ρ · (7/6)πR^3
The gravitational force F between two masses M_remaining and m separated by a distance d = 2R is given by F = G(M_remaining · m)/d^2
Use Newton's Law of Gravitation to find the gravitational force: F = G(ρ · (7/6)πR^3 · m)/(4R^2) = G · (7/24)πR · ρ · m
Express the final answer in terms of the original mass M: F = G · (7/32)M · m
The gravitational force F exerted by the remaining part of the sphere on the point mass m is G(7/32)Mm
